title: Good attention: Attention norms and their role in practical reason, epistemology, and ethics
descriptions:

Title: Good Attention: Attention Norms and their Role in Practical Reason, Epistemology, and Ethics (GOODATTENTION)

This interdisciplinary project investigates the fundamental norms governing human attention, a crucial aspect of cognitive and social functioning. The primary goal is to provide a philosophical framework for understanding attention norms, exploring how they emerge within individual psychology and in the social domain. Our hypothesis is that the fundamental norms of attention concern relevance, and we will evaluate these norms through their integration into normative philosophy.

The project will employ a groundbreaking, interdisciplinary approach, drawing on insights from philosophy, psychology, neuroscience, linguistics, decision theory, epistemology, ethics, evolutionary biology, cognitive psychology, social psychology, economics, and political theory. Research activities will include investigating the biological function of relevance processing, examining the role of social relevance in guiding attention by social norms, considering the role of attention norms in decision making, and analyzing ethical rights and duties regarding attention.

The expected impact of this project is significant, with potential to influence various philosophical fields by integrating norms of attention into their frameworks. Additionally, the project will provide an analytical framework for policy making, informing decision-making processes that rely on attention allocation. By developing a unified foundation for the study of attention norms using a novel conceptual framework based on priority structures that organize the mind, this project promises to advance our understanding of attention and its role in shaping our individual and collective behavior.
